data.title: movie
data.meta_description: MOVIE translate: фильм . Learn more in the Cambridge English-Russian Dictionary.
data.text:
noun [ C ]

uk

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/ˈmuːvi/ us

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

the movies US (UK the cinema)

a cinema, or group of cinemas

кино, кинотеатр

What's playing at the movies?

Why don't we go to the movies tonight?

(Translation of movie from the Cambridge English–Russian Dictionary © Cambridge University Press)

Examples of movie

movie

I suspect that most of my readers, like myself, have never communicated with ghosts; we know them through movies and fiction.

People want to consume music, books, movies, and even potato chips that reflect their own identities.

The second approach animates operations in reverse order and is a pure reverse playback of the original animation recorded as a movie.

The holomovie can be imagined as a movie made up not of still pictures but of holographic pictures.

This boy had seen many movies, heard many stories, and had observed patterns of successful (and unsuccessful) real-world behavior.

This implies that we should keep in touch with a foreign language wherever possible through radio broadcasts, movies, novels, the press - whatever is available.

The introduction of advertisements in the movie depends on the organisation of the movie scenario.

Animation consists of manipulating sequences of pictures or movies.

These examples are from corpora and from sources on the web. Any opinions in the examples do not represent the opinion of the Cambridge Dictionary editors or of Cambridge University Press or its licensors.
